title: Bhagat Singh, Rajguru and Sukhdev were executed on 23 March 1931, not on Valentine’s Day
subtitle: Bhagat Singh, Rajguru and Sukhdev were martyred on 23 March 1931, not on Valentine’s Day. Hence the claim made in the post is FALSE
author: factly.in
vclaim:
A post is being shared on social media with a claim that Bhagat Singh, Rajguru and Sukhdev were hanged to death on 14 February 1931 (i.e. on Valentine’s Day). Let’s try to analyze the claim made in the post.

Every year, 23 March is celebrated as ‘Shaheed Diwas/Martyrs’ Day’ in remembrance of the sacrifice of Bhagat Singh, Rajguru and Sukhdev. A video of ‘DD News’ on the Martyrs’ Day can be watched here.

The article published by ‘The Tribune’, on 25 March 1931, regarding their execution can be found in a tweet by ‘Prasar Bharati’. ‘The Hindu’ article published on 24 March 1931 can be read here.

From the National Archives of India portal, Factly was able to access the fortnightly reports on the internal political situation in India for the month of March 1931. These reports were sent to the British government on a monthly basis. This report makes it clear that the execution of Bhagat Singh along with Sukhdev & Rajguru took place on the evening of 23 March 1931.

To sum it up, Bhagat Singh, Rajguru and Sukhdev were executed on 23 March 1931, not on Valentine’s Day.
